constitution_ref: Art. I ยง8 cl.3 (Commerce Clause)
authority_granted: Prescribe regulations to ensure commercial motor vehicles are operated safely.
Set minimum safety standards for commercial motor carriers and their drivers.
authority_limited: Does not authorize regulation of non-commercial private citizens traveling for personal reasons.
Does not itself create criminal penalties absent further statutory authorization.

preemption.summary: States may not enforce safety requirements that conflict with FMCSA regulations under this authority.

related_cfr.purpose: Defines scope and general applicability of FMCSA safety regulations.

conditions: Funds must support commercial motor vehicle safety enforcement.
Funds may not be used to enforce regulations against non-commercial citizens outside FMCSA scope.

notes: Foundational authority for FMCSA; critical for distinguishing commercial vs non-commercial jurisdiction.

constitution_ref: Art. I ยง8 cl.3 (Commerce Clause)
authority_granted: Specifies which motor carriers and drivers are subject to FMCSA regulations.
Defines general applicability and exceptions for commercial motor vehicle safety rules.
authority_limited: Does not extend FMCSA jurisdiction to purely personal, non-commercial driving.
Cannot enlarge statutory authority beyond what 49 U.S.C. provides.

preemption.summary: State rules that conflict with or expand beyond this scope may be preempted.

notes: Key regulatory definition for who is 'in' and 'out' of FMCSA scope. CDA/CAE use this to detect when states treat non-commercial citizens as commercial drivers.
